intro: Schuurmansia gilgiana, commonly known as the Gilgian rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid conditions. It has compound leaves and produces legume-like pods that contain seeds. Schuurmansia gilgiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry environments.
